snippet: Baboons taught to memorize hundreds of short words were even able to discern real words in new sets, a study shows.
abstract: Dr Jonathan Grainger study in journal Science finds that baboons can differentiate in written language between real English words and nonsensical ones; baboons may be processing letters, and specific combinations of letters, in the same way that humans do in the first stage of the reading process.
lead_paragraph: Baboons taught to memorize hundreds of short words were even able to discern real words in new sets, a study shows.

headline.print_headline: Real Words or Gibberish? Just Ask a Baboon
headline.seo: Baboons Appear to Recognize Words From Gibberish
headline.main: Real Words or Gibberish? Just Ask a Baboon
